001package imagingbook.lib.filter;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack;
004import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
005
006/**
007 * <p>
008 * This (abstract) class represents a filter which treats all pixel values 
009 * as scalars. If the processed image has more than one component 
010 * (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically 
011 * and independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components.
012 * The filter calls the method {@link #doPixel(PixelSlice, int, int)}
013 * for each image pixel, which must be implemented by any concrete
014 * sub-class.
015 * </p>
016 * <p>
017 * Thus a custom filter based on this class only needs to specify the steps
018 * to be performed for a single pixel. The remaining filter mechanics
019 * including multiple components, out-of-bounds coordinate handling,
020 * multiple passes and data copying are handled by this class and its super-class
021 * (see {@link GenericFilter}).
022 * </p>
023 */
024public abstract class GenericFilterScalar extends GenericFilter {
025        
026        // for progress reporting only
027        private int slice;
028        private int sliceMax = 1;
029        
030        private int iter;
031        private int iterMax = 1;
032        
033        // apply filter to a stack of pixel slices (1 pass)
034        @Override
035        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
036                sliceMax = source.getDepth();
037                for (int k = 0; k < sliceMax; k++) {
038                        //IJ.log("+++++++ starting slice " + k);
039                        this.slice = k;
040                        runSlice(source.getSlice(k), target.getSlice(k));       // default behavior: apply filter to each plane, place results in target
041                }
042        }
043        
044        // a bit wasteful, as we provide a separate target for each plane
045        private void runSlice(PixelSlice sourcePlane, PixelSlice targetPlane) {
046                final int width = sourcePlane.getWidth();
047                final int height = sourcePlane.getHeight();
048                this.iterMax = width * height;
049                this.iter = 0;
050                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
051                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
052                                targetPlane.setVal(u, v, doPixel(sourcePlane, u, v));
053                                this.iter++;
054                        }
055                }
056                this.iter = 0;
057        }
058
059        // this method every scalar filter must implement
060        // calculate the result value for a single pixel
061        /**
062         * This method defines the steps to be performed for a single image pixel and
063         * must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
064         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelSlice} container, which
065         * holds the scalar values of one image component.
066         * The method {@link PixelSlice#getVal(int, int)} should be used to read
067         * individual pixel values. These data should not be modified but
068         * the (float) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
069         * 
070         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
071         * @param u the current x-position
072         * @param v the current y-position
073         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
074         */
075        protected abstract float doPixel(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
076        
077        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
078
079        @Override
080        protected final double reportProgress(double subProgress) {
081                double loopProgress = (this.iter + subProgress) / this.iterMax;
082                //IJ.log("   loopProgress = " + loopProgress);
083                double sliceProgress = (this.slice + loopProgress) / this.sliceMax;
084                //IJ.log("   sliceProgress = " + sliceProgress);
085                //System.out.println("reportProgress: GenericFilterScalar " + localProgress);
086                return super.reportProgress(sliceProgress);
087        }
088
089}
